summaries.body: To keep Oscar acceptance speeches from being merely a list of names, producers are asking nominees for advance thank-you lists that could scroll across the screen.

display_asset.caption: Kanye West and Taylor Swift at the 2015 Grammy Awards.

summaries.body: The Kanye West-Taylor Swift feud appears on again after Mr. West released a new song with a couple of crass references to Ms. Swift, which she may or may not have approved.

display_asset.caption: A red-tailed hawk photographed during the Great Backyard Bird Count in 2015.
display_asset.credit: Peter Ferguson/Courtesy Cornell Lab of Ornithology

summaries.body: The Great Backyard Bird Count is upon us this weekend; last year, more than 140,000 people from over 100 countries classified nearly half of the world’s bird types.

display_asset.caption: Virtual reality videos show the water views that will be available from the Turnberry Ocean Club Residences in Florida.

summaries.body: The real estate industry is experimenting with virtual reality technology that could make house-hunting more efficient, including showing homes that have yet to be built.
Bill Cosby’s wife, Camille, will have to testify in a Feb. 22 deposition, but she won't have to talk about their private conversations regarding the defamation case, a judge ruled.

display_asset.caption: Ahmed Omar Sheikh at the high court in Karachi, Pakistan, in 2002.

summaries.body: Pakistan said it had foiled a plot to free about 100 prisoners, including the British-born militant sentenced to death in the 2002 killing of the journalist Daniel Pearl.
The death toll from the war in Syria is at least 470,000, a report said, almost twice the 250,000 counted a year and a half ago by the United Nations.
Sealed materials that lawyers for Sheldon Silver, the former New York State Assembly speaker, had fought to keep secret are set to be released by a judge.

display_asset.caption: The Cima Dome area of the Mojave National Preserve. President Obama is granting national monument status to nearly 1.8 million acres of California desert that would link existing protected lands like this one.
display_asset.credit: David Danelski/The Press-Enterprise, via Associated Press

summaries.body: President Obama plans to designate three new national monuments in the California desert, nearly doubling the amount of public land he has protected as president.
A congressman decided to use his vape pen during a legislative session to argue against a bill that would ban the use of vaporizers on airplanes.

display_asset.caption: A former Guantánamo detainee, Younis Shokuri, was released from a Moroccan jail on Thursday.

summaries.body: Younis Shokuri, a former detainee at the Guantánamo Bay prison, was freed from a Moroccan prison where he spent nearly five months after his transfer to the country.
C.E.O.s and secretaries? Or fire inspectors and teachers? We tend to marry within the same occupation, U.S. Census data show. But there are also unlikely pairings.

display_asset.caption: Steve Kerr played for the The 1995-96 Bulls. Now he coaches the team that may break their wins record.

summaries.body: Steve Kerr helped the Chicago Bulls set a record for N.B.A. wins. Now, as coach of the Golden State Warriors, he’s on a pace to break that record.

display_asset.caption: Imani Perry, a professor at Princeton.

summaries.body: The police have released video of a traffic stop that led to the arrest of a black Princeton professor, who said she was mistreated.
An independent report claims that Airbnb “misled the media and the public” by deleting over 1,000 listings to show that its hosts obeyed New York City’s rules.
Did the Supreme Court kill the Paris climate accord? Maybe. We explain.
Uber has agreed to pay $28.5 million to settle a lawsuit that claimed the company misrepresented the level of scrutiny it used when recruiting drivers.
A survey of 1,500 science teachers in the United States found that they devote just one to two hours a year on climate change, and many provide misinformation.

display_asset.caption: Beyoncé performing at a concert in Los Angeles last year.

summaries.body: Too often a fan's euphoria at the thought of seeing a star like Beyoncé in concert gives way to disappointment and anger after bots and scalpers scoop up all the tickets.

display_asset.caption: A math class at Match Charter School in Boston, which is doing a lot of test prep for the SAT. Reading passages will be harder and math problems wordier in the new test.
display_asset.credit: Shiho Fukada for The New York Times

summaries.body: After reading our article on the redesigned SAT with its emphasis on reading skills, some readers lauded the changes while others cited a variety of potential biases.
Bruce Springsteen's autobiography, “Born to Run,” will be published Sept. 27, and the rock star said it would cover the “poetry, danger and darkness” of his New Jersey childhood.

display_asset.caption: A woman with a picture of Tamir Rice during a protest over the fatal 2014 shooting of the 12-year-old by a Cleveland police officer.

summaries.body: The city of Cleveland has rescinded its pursuit of $500 in medical costs from the family of Tamir Rice, 12, who was killed by the police while holding a pellet gun in 2014.

display_asset.caption: James Woods in 2012. He is seeking $10 million worth of damages from an anonymous Twitter user.

summaries.body: A California judge has put the actor James Woods closer to unmasking an anonymous Twitter user he claims defamed him.
Morgan Stanley will pay $3.2 billion in a settlement with state and federal authorities over its creation of mortgage-backed bonds before the financial crisis.

display_asset.caption: Lincoln Center Plaza.
display_asset.credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times

summaries.body: The inaugural class of the Lincoln Center Hall of Fame will comprise Louis Armstrong, Plácido Domingo, Yo-Yo Ma, Audra McDonald, Leontyne Price and Harold Prince.

display_asset.caption: An HSBC branch in central London. The lender announced on Thursday that it would reinstate pay increases after receiving feedback from employees.

summaries.body: HSBC, which unveiled plans last month to freeze hiring and pay, now says it will allow pay increases this year but will keep the hiring ban in place.

display_asset.caption: People waited for news outside Topo Chico Prison in Monterrey, Mexico, on Thursday.

summaries.body: Dozens of people were killed in a prison riot in northeastern Mexico, days before a planned visit by Pope Francis to another prison in the country.

display_asset.caption: Reinhold Hanning, center, a former guard at Auschwitz, in court in Detmold, Germany, on Thursday.

summaries.body: The trial of Reinhold Hanning, 94, a former guard at Auschwitz charged with being an accessory to the murder of at least 170,000 people, opened in Germany on Thursday.
A 25-year-old Jewish man dressed in Hasidic clothing was stabbed in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, in what the police are investigating as a possible hate crime.
A wild elephant went on a seven-hour rampage through an Indian town before it was tranquilized.
